title: Terrifying speed of a new climate-driven fire in Natimuk, Victoria | ABC NEWS
description: Natimuk, a community in western Victoria, is in recovery after a grass fire destroyed more than a dozen homes, leaving residents with little time to evacuate. This fire represents a new, faster type of bushfire that is becoming increasingly common due to climate change. title: Greens join Coalition in rejecting Labor's proposed hate speech reform | ABC NEWS
description: The Greens have decided against supporting the Albanese government's proposed hate crime reforms due to concerns about civil liberties and free speech. The party said it would back laws targeting gun control that were proposed in the same overhaul, but not those relating to hate crime, which it called "divisive" and "not supportable". title: US President firm on Greenland, appears to back down on Iran | ABC NEWS
description: President Donald Trump has threatened tariffs on countries opposing US control of Greenland, citing national security and not ruling out the use of force. A bipartisan congressional delegation led by Senator Chris Coons met with Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen to address diplomatic tensions. Trump told Iranian protesters he would "act accordingly" regarding the regime's crackdown. However, he has now indicated that Iran's cancellation of 800 scheduled hangings has reduced the threat of US military intervention. title: Taking paracetamol during pregnancy not linked to autism or ADHD in children, study finds | ABC NEWS
description: A world-leading journal, The Lancet, has found no evidence that using paracetamol during pregnancy increases the risk of developmental harm. title: Children in Ukraine risk hypothermia after Russian attacks, aid groups say | ABC NEWS
description: Families in Ukraine are at risk of hypothermia, according to UNICEF. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy declared a state of emergency earlier this week due to Russian attacks on energy infrastructure. title: New police figures show crimes down nearly everywhere in NT | ABC NEWS
description: If you've felt a bit safer in the Territory lately, the latest police numbers might explain why.  November was one of the best months on record with crimes down nearly everywhere across the NT.  While it's mostly good news, some locations have clearly benefitted more from the law changes more than others. Joseph Hathaway-Wilson has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Labor forced to split gun and hate speech reforms bill in two after political opposition | ABC NEWS
description: The prime minister has announced a major backdown on his government's hate speech laws drafted in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. Just days before it was set to be introduced to parliament, he has now split the bill after the Greens and Coalition made it clear they would not support the changes aimed at tackling antisemitism. Political reporter Romy Stephens explains. title: Woman dies after tree falls on her car as winds lash NSW coast | ABC NEWS
description: Severe weather in New South Wales has led to a tragedy, as a woman in her 40s died when a tree branch fell on her car at Macquarie Pass. A male passenger sustained minor injuries. Police have closed the road for several hours and advised motorists to avoid the area. As heavy rain and strong winds continued, the New South Wales SES has received around 900 calls for help and has performed at least five rescues due to flash flooding along the coast. description: The national day of mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack will be themed 'Light will win — a gathering of unity and remembrance'. title: Midwife banned from working unsupervised handed $1.1m NT government contract | ABC NEWS
description: A Darwin midwife who's been put under a number of conditions by Australia's nursing and midwifery regulator will continue to run the Northern Territory government's new private practice midwifery service.   Claire Marks was awarded a 1.1-million-dollar contract by the NT government to run the service for 12 months, but the Australian Medical Association has raised concerns. Roxanne Fitzgerald has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: The reality of having a child diagnosed with brain cancer | ABC NEWS
description: Brain cancer's survival rates have changed little over the last 30 years and it's the cancer that kills the most children in Australia.  Advocates say government funding allocated to brain cancer research is below that of other cancers and much more could be done to save lives.
